description: The NK1 segment contains information about the patient's other related parties. Any associated parties may be identified. Utilizing NK1-1 - set ID, multiple NK1 segments can be sent to patient accounts.

fields.name: Set ID - NK1
fields.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one, for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two, etc.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: This field contains the name of the next of kin or associated party. Multiple names for the same person are allowed, but the legal name must be sent in the first sequence. If the legal name is not sent, then the repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name Type for valid values.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, "FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.description: This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to 2.A.88.12, "Effective Date" and 2.A.88.13, "Expiration Date" components.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the DTM (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 0444 - Name assembly order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Relationship
fields.description: This field contains the actual personal relationship that the next of kin/associated party has to the patient. Refer to User-defined Table 0063 - Relationship for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: This field contains the address of the next of kin/associated party. Multiple addresses are allowed for the same person. The mailing address must be sent in the first sequence. If the mailing address is not sent, then the repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence.

fields.name: Street Address
fields.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, and similar address information.

fields.name: Street Or Mailing Address
fields.description: This component specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this first component is used to specify the institution name. When used in connection with a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.

fields.name: Other Designation
fields.description: This component contains the second line of address. In US usage, it qualifies address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. When referencing an institution, this component specifies the street address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: This component specifies the city, or district or place where the addressee is located depending upon the national convention for formatting addresses for postal usage.

fields.name: State Or Province
fields.description: This component specifies the state or province where the addressee is located. State or province should be represented by the official postal service codes for that country.

fields.name: Zip Or Postal Code
fields.description: This component specifies the zip or postal code where the addressee is located. Zip or postal codes should be represented by the official codes for that country. In the US, the zip code takes the form 99999[-9999], while the Canadian postal code takes the form A9A9A9, and the Australian Postcode takes the form 9999.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: This component specifies the country where the addressee is located. HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 be used for the country code. Refer to HL7 Table 0399 - Country code in section 2.15.9.17, "MSH-17 - Country code" for valid values.

fields.name: Address Type
fields.description: This component specifies the kind or type of address. Refer to HL7 Table 0190 - Address type for valid values.

fields.name: Other Geographic Designation
fields.description: This component specifies any other geographic designation. It includes county, bioregion, SMSA, etc.

fields.name: County/Parish Code
fields.description: A code that represents the county in which the specified address resides. User-defined Table 0289 - County/parish is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. When this component is used to represent the county (or parish), component 8 <other geographic designation> should not duplicate it (i.e., the use of <other geographic designation> to represent the county is allowed only for the purpose of backward compatibility, and should be discouraged in this and future versions of HL7).

fields.name: Census Tract
fields.description: A code that represents the census tract in which the specified address resides. User-defined Table 0288 - Census tract is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Address Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same name/address should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Address Validity Range
fields.description: This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to 2.A.85.13, Effective Date and 2.A.85.14, Expiration Date components.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the DTM (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.

fields.name: Expiration Reason
fields.description: This identifies why this address was marked as "ended".

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Temporary Indicator
fields.description: If "Y" this indicates that the address is considered temporary. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator .

fields.name: Bad Address Indicator
fields.description: If "Y", this indicates that it is not possible to contact the "owning" entity at this address. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator.

fields.name: Address Usage
fields.description: This indicates how the address is intended to be used.

fields.name: Addressee
fields.description: Identifies the name of the person or organization that should appear as part of the address. This is also known as the "Care of" or "C/O" line.

fields.name: Comment
fields.description: Descriptive information about the use of the address.

fields.name: Preference Order
fields.description: For an entity having multiple addresses, indicates which is the 'most preferred' (lowest number) to 'least preferred' (highest number).

fields.name: Protection Code
fields.description: Identifies that an address needs to be treated with special care or sensitivity.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Address Identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the address.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Phone Number
fields.description:
This field contains the telephone number of the next of kin/associated party. Multiple phone numbers are allowed for the same person. The primary telephone number must be sent in the first sequence. If the primary telephone number is not sent, then the repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 - Telecommunication Use Code and HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication Equipment Type for valid values.

Phone number must be set to 1 for <preference order> component.  
To maintain backwards compatibility for V2.6 and V2.7, this field shall send only telephone number. Non-telephone number data such as email addresses shall not be sent via this field.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.description: The XTN-1 component was deprecated as of v2.3 and the detail was withdrawn and removed from the standard as of v 2.6.

fields.name: Telecommunication Use Code
fields.description: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication Equipment Type
fields.description: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Communication Address
fields.description: This component is required if neither XTN.7 or XTN.12 are populated.

fields.name: Country Code
fields.description: The numeric code assigned by the International Telecommunication Union in standard E.164 to access telephone services in another country.

fields.name: Area/City Code
fields.description: The numeric code to access telephone services in another area/city within a country. This number historically needs not be dialed if the caller is located in the same area/city as the phone number of the called party.

fields.name: Local Number
fields.description: The numeric code used to contact the called party, exclusive of country and area/city codes. The size of the Local Number is country specific.

fields.name: Extension
fields.description: The numeric code to contact the called party used within an organization, e.g., the number used if both caller and called party are located within the same organization. The extension is often the same as the last few digits of the Local Number. The use of extensions is country and site specific, and may depend on the type of phone system (PBX) used by the organization.

fields.name: Any Text
fields.description: Contains comments with respect to the telephone number.

fields.name: Extension Prefix
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system network used as a prefix to the Extension component for internal dialing. Note that the use of Extension Prefix requires that the Extension component be valued and that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Speed Dial Code
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system used in place of the (external) telephone number to facilitate calling because its length is shorter than that of the telephone number. Note that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Unformatted Telephone Number
fields.description: An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string.

fields.name: Effective Start Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the telecommunication number is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the telecommunication number is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Reason
fields.description: Indicates why this contact number/e-mail was marked as "ended".

If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Protection Code
fields.description: Indicates whether this information is considered sensitive or should be protected in some way. Refer to User-defined table 0618 - Protection Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Shared Telecommunication Identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the phone number or e-mail address.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Preference Order
fields.description: For an entity having multiple telecommunication addresses, indicates which is the "most preferred" (lowest number) to "least preferred" (highest number).

fields.name: Contact Role
fields.description: This field indicates the specific relationship role. Refer to User-defined Table 0131 - Contact Role for suggested values. This field specifies the role that the next of kin/associated parties plays with regard to the patient.

fields.name: Start Date
fields.description: This field contains the start date of the contact role.

fields.name: End Date
fields.description: This field contains the end date of the contact role.

fields.name: Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Title
fields.description: This field contains the title of the next of kin/associated parties at their place of employment. However, if the contact role is the patient's employer, this field contains the job title of the patient at their place of employment.

fields.name: Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Code/Class
fields.description:
This field contains the employer's job code and the employee classification used for the next of kin/associated parties at their place of employment. However, if the contact role is the patient's employer, this field contains the job code/class of the patient at their place of employment.

Note:  The JCC data element appears in other segments as ITEM# 00786 (GT1-50, IN2-47, STF-19).  It is assigned a different ITEM# in the NK1 segment because the element name and usage is variable.  For example the job code/class can be for the patient's employer, or for an associated party's employment information.

fields.name: Job Code
fields.description: This component contains the persons job code. User-defined Table 0327 - Job code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Job Class
fields.description: This component contains the persons employee classification. Refer to User-defined Table 0328 - Employee classification for suggested values.

fields.name: Job Description Text
fields.description: This component contains the text of the job description. This will accommodate systems where job descriptions are not codified.

fields.name: Next of Kin / Associated Parties Employee Number
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID with Check Digit
fields.description: For backward compatibility, the ST data type can be sent; however, HL7 recommends that the CX data type be used for new implementations. This field contains the number that the employer assigns to the employee that is acting as next of kin/associated parties. However, if the contact role is the patient's employer, this field contains the employee number of the patient at their place of employment. The assigning authority and identifier type codes are strongly recommended for all CX data types.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: The value of the identifier itself.

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: A digit, or digits, exclusive of the identifier in CX.1, usually calculated by applying an algorithm to all or some of the digits in the number, which may be used to test validity of the non-check-digit identifier.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique name of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. . Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the patient. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.description: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Organization Name - NK1
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name and Identification Number for Organizations
fields.description: This field contains the name of the organization that serves as a next of kin/associated party or as the next of kin of the patient. This field may also be used to communicate the name of the organization at which the associated party works. Multiple names for the same organization may be sent. If multiple names are sent, the legal name must be sent in the first sequence. If the legal name is not sent, then a repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence.

fields.name: Organization Name
fields.description: The name of the specified organization.

fields.name: Organization Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name i.e., legal name, display name. Refer to User-defined Table 0204 - Organizational Name Type for suggested values.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This component has been retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. It is recommended to use component 10 Organization identifier that accommodates alphanumeric identifiers.

fields.description: This component contains the digit, or digits, exclusive of the identifier in XON.1, usually calculated by applying an algorithm to all or some of the digits in the number, which may be used to test validity of the non-check-digit identifier.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the "Assigning authority" component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Organization Identifier
fields.description: This component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by XON.1 Organization Name. This component replaces XON.3 ID Number as of v 2.5.

fields.name: Marital Status
fields.description: This field contains the next of kin/associated party's marital status. Refer to User-defined Table 0002 - Marital Status for suggested values.

fields.name: Administrative Sex
fields.description: This field contains the next of kin/associated party's sex. Refer to User-defined Table 0001 - Administrative Sex for suggested values.

fields.name: Date/Time of Birth
fields.description: This field contains the next of kin/associated party's birth date and time.

fields.name: Living Dependency
fields.description: This field identifies specific living conditions (e.g., spouse dependent on patient, walk-up) that are relevant to an evaluation of the patient's healthcare needs. This information can be used for discharge planning. Examples might include Spouse Dependent, Medical Supervision Required, Small Children Dependent. This field repeats because, for example, "spouse dependent" and "medical supervision required" can apply at the same time. Refer to User-defined Table 0223 - Living Dependency for suggested values.

fields.name: Ambulatory Status
fields.description: This field identifies the transient rate of mobility for the next of kin/associated party. Refer to User-defined Table 0009 - Ambulatory Status for suggested values.

fields.name: Citizenship
fields.description: This field contains the code to identify the next of kin/associated party's citizenship. HL7 recommends using ISO 3166 as the suggested values in User-defined Table 0171 - Citizenship .

fields.name: Protection Indicator
fields.description: This field identifies that next of kin/associated party's protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Student Indicator
fields.description: This field identifies whether the next of kin/associated party is currently a student or not, and whether the next of kin/associated party is a full- or a part-time student. This field does not indicate the degree (high school, college) of the student or the field of study. Refer to User-defined Table 0231 - Student Status in Chapter 6 for suggested values.

fields.name: Religion
fields.description: This field indicates the type of religion practiced by the next of kin/associated party. Refer to User-defined Table 0006 - Religion for suggested values.

If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Mother's Maiden Name
fields.description: This field indicates the maiden name of the next of kin/associated party's mother.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, "FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.description: This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to 2.A.88.12, "Effective Date" and 2.A.88.13, "Expiration Date" components.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the DTM (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 0444 - Name assembly order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Nationality
fields.description: This field identifies the nation or national group to which the next of kin/associated party belongs. This information may be different than the person's citizenship in countries in which multiple nationalities are recognized (e.g., Spain: Basque, Catalan, etc.). Refer to User-defined Table 0212 - Nationality for suggested values.

fields.name: Ethnic Group
fields.description: This field contains the next of kin/associated party's ethnic group. Refer to User-defined Table 0189 - Ethnic Group for suggested values. The second triplet of the CWE data type for ethnic group (alternate identifier, alternate text, and name of alternate coding system) is reserved for governmentally assigned codes. In the US, a current use is to report ethnicity in line with US federal standards for Hispanic origin.

fields.description: This field identifies how the contact should be used (e.g., contact employer if patient is unable to work). Refer to User-defined Table 0222 - Contact Reason in Chapter 6 for suggested values.

fields.name: Contact Person's Telephone Number
fields.description:
This field contains the telephone numbers of the contact person depending on the value of the relationship defined in NK1-3 - Relationship. This field is typically needed when the NK1 is an organization. The primary telephone number must be sent in the first sequence. If the primary telephone number is not sent, then a repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 -Telecommunication Use Code and HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication Equipment Type for valid values.

Phone number must be set to 1 for <preference order> component. To maintain backwards compatibility for V2.6 and V2.7, this field shall send only telephone number. Non-telephone number data such as email addresses shall not be sent via this field.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.description: The XTN-1 component was deprecated as of v2.3 and the detail was withdrawn and removed from the standard as of v 2.6.

fields.name: Telecommunication Use Code
fields.description: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication Equipment Type
fields.description: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Communication Address
fields.description: This component is required if neither XTN.7 or XTN.12 are populated.

fields.name: Country Code
fields.description: The numeric code assigned by the International Telecommunication Union in standard E.164 to access telephone services in another country.

fields.name: Area/City Code
fields.description: The numeric code to access telephone services in another area/city within a country. This number historically needs not be dialed if the caller is located in the same area/city as the phone number of the called party.

fields.name: Local Number
fields.description: The numeric code used to contact the called party, exclusive of country and area/city codes. The size of the Local Number is country specific.

fields.name: Extension
fields.description: The numeric code to contact the called party used within an organization, e.g., the number used if both caller and called party are located within the same organization. The extension is often the same as the last few digits of the Local Number. The use of extensions is country and site specific, and may depend on the type of phone system (PBX) used by the organization.

fields.name: Any Text
fields.description: Contains comments with respect to the telephone number.

fields.name: Extension Prefix
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system network used as a prefix to the Extension component for internal dialing. Note that the use of Extension Prefix requires that the Extension component be valued and that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Speed Dial Code
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system used in place of the (external) telephone number to facilitate calling because its length is shorter than that of the telephone number. Note that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Unformatted Telephone Number
fields.description: An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string.

fields.name: Effective Start Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the telecommunication number is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the telecommunication number is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Reason
fields.description: Indicates why this contact number/e-mail was marked as "ended".

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Protection Code
fields.description: Indicates whether this information is considered sensitive or should be protected in some way. Refer to User-defined table 0618 - Protection Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Original Text

fields.name: Shared Telecommunication Identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the phone number or e-mail address.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Preference Order
fields.description: For an entity having multiple telecommunication addresses, indicates which is the "most preferred" (lowest number) to "least preferred" (highest number).

fields.name: Contact Person's Address
fields.description: This field contains the addresses of the contact person depending on the value of the relationship defined in NK1-3 - Relationship. This field is typically used when the NK1 is an organization. When multiple addresses are sent, the mailing address must be sent first in the sequence.

fields.name: Street Address
fields.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, and similar address information.

fields.name: Street Or Mailing Address
fields.description: This component specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this first component is used to specify the institution name. When used in connection with a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.

fields.name: Other Designation
fields.description: This component contains the second line of address. In US usage, it qualifies address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. When referencing an institution, this component specifies the street address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: This component specifies the city, or district or place where the addressee is located depending upon the national convention for formatting addresses for postal usage.

fields.name: State Or Province
fields.description: This component specifies the state or province where the addressee is located. State or province should be represented by the official postal service codes for that country.

fields.name: Zip Or Postal Code
fields.description: This component specifies the zip or postal code where the addressee is located. Zip or postal codes should be represented by the official codes for that country. In the US, the zip code takes the form 99999[-9999], while the Canadian postal code takes the form A9A9A9, and the Australian Postcode takes the form 9999.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: This component specifies the country where the addressee is located. HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 be used for the country code. Refer to HL7 Table 0399 - Country code in section 2.15.9.17, "MSH-17 - Country code" for valid values.

fields.name: Address Type
fields.description: This component specifies the kind or type of address. Refer to HL7 Table 0190 - Address type for valid values.

fields.name: Other Geographic Designation
fields.description: This component specifies any other geographic designation. It includes county, bioregion, SMSA, etc.

fields.name: County/Parish Code
fields.description: A code that represents the county in which the specified address resides. User-defined Table 0289 - County/parish is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. When this component is used to represent the county (or parish), component 8 <other geographic designation> should not duplicate it (i.e., the use of <other geographic designation> to represent the county is allowed only for the purpose of backward compatibility, and should be discouraged in this and future versions of HL7).

fields.name: Census Tract
fields.description: A code that represents the census tract in which the specified address resides. User-defined Table 0288 - Census tract is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Address Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same name/address should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Address Validity Range
fields.description: This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to 2.A.85.13, Effective Date and 2.A.85.14, Expiration Date components.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the DTM (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active for the ‘owning’ entity.

fields.name: Expiration Reason
fields.description: This identifies why this address was marked as "ended".

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Temporary Indicator
fields.description: If "Y" this indicates that the address is considered temporary. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator .

fields.name: Bad Address Indicator
fields.description: If "Y", this indicates that it is not possible to contact the "owning" entity at this address. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator.

fields.name: Address Usage
fields.description: This indicates how the address is intended to be used.

fields.name: Addressee
fields.description: Identifies the name of the person or organization that should appear as part of the address. This is also known as the "Care of" or "C/O" line.

fields.name: Comment
fields.description: Descriptive information about the use of the address.

fields.name: Preference Order
fields.description: For an entity having multiple addresses, indicates which is the 'most preferred' (lowest number) to 'least preferred' (highest number).

fields.name: Protection Code
fields.description: Identifies that an address needs to be treated with special care or sensitivity.

If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Address Identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the address.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Next of Kin/Associated Party's Identifiers
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID with Check Digit
fields.description: This field contains the identifiers for the next of kin/associated party, for example, Social Security Number, driver's license, etc. The assigning authority and identifier type code are strongly recommended for all CX data types.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: The value of the identifier itself.

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: A digit, or digits, exclusive of the identifier in CX.1, usually calculated by applying an algorithm to all or some of the digits in the number, which may be used to test validity of the non-check-digit identifier.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique name of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. . Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the patient. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.description: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Race

The second triplet of the CWE data type for race (alternate identifier, alternate text, and name of alternate coding system) is reserved for governmentally assigned codes.

fields.name: Handicap
fields.description: This field contains the code that describes an associated party's disability. Refer to User-defined Table 0295 - Handicap for suggested values.

fields.name: Contact Person Social Security Number
fields.description: In the US, this field contains the contact person's social security number. This number may also be a RR retirement number. For the Social Security number of the associated party, see NK1-33 - Next of Kin/Associated Party's identifiers.

fields.name: Next of Kin Birth Place
fields.description: This field indicates the location of the next-of-kin's birth; for example, "St. Francis Community Hospital of Lower South Side." The actual address is reported in NK1-4 - Address with an identifier of "N".

fields.name: VIP Indicator
fields.description: This field identifies the type of VIP for the next-of-kin. Refer to User-defined Table 0099 - VIP Indicator .
